Description: Grey granite cone-shaped pestle; the narrower end is rounded, the wider end is gently rounded and chipped.
Curator's comments: W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 74 § 70 mentions "two basalt mullers for grinding" "found in the camp".
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 74 § 70) (?)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.77-78, p.185, pl.27)
